title: St Peters Way Walking Route

images.title: Stuart Shepherd / High Street, Chipping Ongar
images.caption: High Street, Chipping Ongar. Route Start. Looking North - and a little to the North West of St Martin of Tours

images.title: Glyn Baker / Footpath to Sparrow Wycke Farm
images.caption: Footpath to Sparrow Wycke Farm. This farm is in Mundon south of Maldon and stands on the St Peters Way long distance path.

images.title: Glyn Baker / St Peters Way
images.caption: This is the St Peters Way long distance path south of Black House Court Farm looking towards Tillingham.

images.title: Glyn Baker / Steeplewick Farm
images.caption: Steeplewick Farm. This picture was taken from the footpath that runs from The St Peters Way on Bradwell Rd to Stansgate Abbey Farm

images.title: Glyn Baker / Footpath to Stansgate Abbey Farm
images.caption: Footpath to Stansgate Abbey Farm

images.title: Robert Edwards / 'The Bell' inn at Purleigh
images.caption: 'The Bell' inn at Purleigh. This inn stands next to Purleigh parish church. It could be that part of the building sits in the next grid square.

images.title: Hywel Williams, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St. Peter on the Wall. The 7th century church at the end of the route.

description: Travel from Chipping Ongar to the 7th century St Peter's Chapel on St Peter's Flat on this walk through Essex. The walk first heads to Maylandsea passing Hanningfield Reservoir and Purleigh on the way. The second section heads to St Peter's Flat via Tillingham. At the end of the route you could head west from the chapel to visit the village of Bradwell on Sea where there's a fine old pub for refreshment.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: At Hanningfield Reservoir you could stop at the Cafe on the Water for some refreshments on the route. There is a lovely area outside on the decking with spectacular views over the Reservoir, which is open from April to November each year. It's the perfect place to relax on a warm summer day.

display_address: Castle Street, Ongar, Chipping Ongar, Epping Forest, Essex, England, CM5 9JY, United Kingdom
